Kayako - ticket id 60149875 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear Jessica,

Thank you for your follow-up regarding the persistent issue with the “Role does not equal” filter in Community Analytics for the Emerging Leaders Forum. We understand the urgency and appreciate the detailed information, screenshots, and CSV exports you have provided.

Summary of Observations:
Your testing confirms that when you apply the filter Role equals (Administrator, Moderator, LPL Home Office), only those users appear as expected. However, when you apply the filter Role does not equal (Administrator, Moderator, LPL Home Office), those same users are still included in the results for the Emerging Leaders Forum, which is not the intended behavior. This issue appears isolated to this specific forum, as clearing the browser cache resolved similar issues for other communities.

Relevant Product Behavior and Limitations:
Based on the official documentation (Apply filters to Community Analytics reports [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125911] and Tips on using advanced filters for Community Analytics [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125912]), the Role filter is designed to include or exclude users based on their assigned roles. However, there are known limitations when users have multiple roles assigned: the filter may not fully exclude users who match any of the specified roles if they also have additional roles. This is consistent with the behavior you are experiencing.

Additional points from the documentation:

 	* Filter rules are case sensitive. Ensure that role names are entered exactly as they appear in your role list.
 	* You can enter multiple values in each rule as a comma-separated list (no spaces after the comma).
 	* When users have overlapping or multiple roles, the “does not equal” filter may not exclude them as intended.

Recommended Workaround:
As a reliable workaround, you can export the full member data for the Emerging Leaders Forum and apply additional filtering in Excel or another analytics tool to exclude users with the specified roles. The export includes a Role column, which allows you to filter out users with Admin, Moderator, or LPL Home Office roles manually.

For step-by-step instructions on applying filters and exporting member data, please refer to the following articles:

 	* Apply filters to Community Analytics reports [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125911]
 	* Tips on using advanced filters for Community Analytics [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125912]
 	* Analytics Filters and Exporting Reports [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125006]

Summary:
The behavior you are experiencing is a known limitation of the Community Analytics filtering logic when users have multiple roles assigned. While the Role equals filter works as expected, the Role does not equal filter may not fully exclude users with overlapping roles. Exporting the data and applying additional filtering externally is currently the most reliable solution.

If you have any further questions about filter configuration, analytics reporting, or need clarification on the export process, please let us know. We are here to assist you as you continue your analysis.

Sincerely,
Atlas
Khoros Community Classic Support Team.

-------------------------

Kayako - ticket id 60149875 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear Jessica,

Thank you for your detailed update and for providing both screenshots and CSV exports regarding the filtering issue in the Emerging Leaders Forum within Community Analytics. Based on your description and the attached files, it is clear that the “Role does not equal” filter is not excluding users with the specified roles (Administrator, Moderator, LPL Home Office) as expected, even though the “Role equals” filter works correctly for the same roles.

Key Observations:

 	* Your screenshots and exports confirm that when you set the filter to Role equals Admin, Moderator, and LPL Home Office, only those users appear, which is correct.
 	* However, when you set the filter to Role does not equal Admin, Moderator, and LPL Home Office, those same users are still included in the results, which is not the intended behavior.
 	* This issue appears to be isolated to the Emerging Leaders Forum, as clearing the browser cache resolved similar issues for other communities.

Relevant Product Behavior and Limitations:

 	* According to the articles Apply filters to Community Analytics reports [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125911] and Tips on using advanced filters for Community Analytics [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125912], the Role filter is designed to include or exclude users based on their assigned roles. However, there are known limitations when users have multiple roles assigned—the filter may not fully exclude users who match any of the specified roles if they also have additional roles.
 	* Filter rules are case sensitive, and values must be entered exactly as they appear in your role list. If there are any discrepancies in role naming or assignment, this can affect filter results.
 	* For more granular filtering, you can enter multiple values in each rule as a comma-separated list (no spaces after the comma), as you have done.

Recommended Steps and Workarounds:

 	* Review Role Assignments: Double-check the role assignments for the users appearing incorrectly in the filtered results. If these users have multiple roles (including one of the excluded roles and another role), the filter may not exclude them as intended due to product limitations.
 	* Export and Post-Process: As a workaround, you can export the full member data for the Emerging Leaders Forum and apply additional filtering in Excel or another analytics tool to exclude users with the specified roles. The export includes a Role column, which allows you to filter out users with Admin, Moderator, or LPL Home Office roles manually.

	* Reference Articles: For step-by-step instructions on applying filters and exporting member data, please see: 

 	* Apply filters to Community Analytics reports [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125911]
 	* Tips on using advanced filters for Community Analytics [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125912]
 	* View and download community member metrics [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125934]

Summary:

The behavior you are experiencing is consistent with a known limitation in Community Analytics filtering when users have multiple roles assigned. While the Role equals filter works as expected, the Role does not equal filter may not fully exclude users with overlapping roles. The most reliable workaround is to export the data and apply additional filtering externally.

If you have any further questions about filter configuration or need clarification on the export process, please let us know. We are here to assist you as you continue your analysis.

Sincerely,
Atlas
Khoros Community Classic Support Team.

Kayako - ticket id 60149875 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear Jessica,

Thank you for your update and for letting us know that you are still reviewing the information regarding the Community Analytics Reporting filters.

To summarize, when applying multiple Role, not equals filters in Community Analytics, users with those roles (such as Admin, LPL Home Office, and Moderator) may still appear in the results if they have multiple roles assigned or if there are overlapping role assignments. This is a known limitation of the filtering logic in Community Analytics.

For your reference, here are some best practices and resources to help you achieve more accurate filtering:

 	* Filter Logic: When using several not equals filters for the same field, the system is designed to exclude users matching any of the specified roles. However, if a user has multiple roles, they may not be fully excluded. Reviewing user role assignments in your user management section can help clarify if overlapping roles are affecting your results.
 	* Advanced Filtering: For more complex scenarios, consider using a combination of equals and not equals filters, or grouping filters where possible. The article Tips on using advanced filters for Community Analytics [https://community.khoros.com/t5/Community-Analytics/Tips-on-using-advanced-filters-for-Community-Analytics/ta-p/625912] provides additional strategies for refining your reports.
 	* Exporting and Reviewing Data: If the exported CSV data still includes users with excluded roles, ensure that the filter criteria are correctly set before export. Sometimes, refreshing the report or clearing your browser cache can help apply the latest filter settings.
 	* Known Limitations and Workarounds: If users with excluded roles continue to appear due to multi-role assignments, you may need to export the full data set and apply additional filtering in Excel or another analytics tool as a temporary workaround.

	* Step-by-Step Guidance: For detailed instructions on applying filters and downloading member metrics, please refer to the following articles: 

 	* Apply filters to Community Analytics reports [https://community.khoros.com/t5/Community-Analytics/Apply-filters-to-Community-Analytics-reports/ta-p/625911]
 	* View and download community member metrics [https://community.khoros.com/t5/Community-Analytics/View-and-download-community-member-metrics/ta-p/625934]

If you have any further questions or need clarification on filter setup or analytics reporting, please let us know. We are here to assist you as you continue your review.

Sincerely,
Atlas
Khoros Community Classic Support Team.

Kayako - ticket id 60149875 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear Jessica,

Thank you for your prompt response and for providing the requested details regarding the issue with filters not working as expected in Community Analytics Reporting.

Based on your description, it appears that when applying multiple "Role, not equals" filters in the Community Analytics reports, users with those roles (such as Admin, LPL Home Office, and Moderator) are still appearing in the results, particularly under the Members tab for the specified boards. This is not the expected behavior, as the filters should exclude those roles from the report output.

Recommended Steps and Considerations:

1. Review Filter Logic:
When using multiple "not equals" filters for the same field (e.g., Role), the filter logic in Community Analytics is designed to exclude users who match any of the specified roles. However, if a user has multiple roles assigned, or if there are custom role hierarchies, the filter may not behave as intended. Please ensure that each user has only one of the roles being filtered, or consider using a combination of "equals" and "not equals" filters for more precise results.

2. Advanced Filtering Tips:
Refer to our article Apply filters to Community Analytics reports [https://community.khoros.com/t5/Community-Analytics/Apply-filters-to-Community-Analytics-reports/ta-p/625911] for guidance on setting up filters. For more complex scenarios, the article Tips on using advanced filters for Community Analytics [https://community.khoros.com/t5/Community-Analytics/Tips-on-using-advanced-filters-for-Community-Analytics/ta-p/625912] provides additional strategies, such as grouping filters or using "OR" and "AND" logic where available.

3. Exported Data Review:
If the exported CSV data still includes users with excluded roles, double-check the filter criteria before export. Sometimes, the UI may display cached results; refreshing the report or clearing browser cache can help ensure the latest filter settings are applied.

4. Known Limitations:
There are known limitations when filtering by roles if users have overlapping or multiple roles. In such cases, the filter may not exclude all intended users. As a workaround, you may need to adjust your role assignments or use additional filters (such as filtering by specific board names or user attributes) to refine your results.

5. Viewing and Downloading Metrics:
For step-by-step instructions on viewing and downloading member metrics, please see View and download community member metrics [https://community.khoros.com/t5/Community-Analytics/View-and-download-community-member-metrics/ta-p/625934].

Example:
If you wish to exclude users with roles Admin, LPL Home Office, and Moderator, ensure your filters are set as follows:

 	* Role not equals Admin
 	* Role not equals LPL Home Office
 	* Role not equals Moderator

 If users still appear, verify their role assignments in the user management section to confirm they do not have additional roles that may affect filter logic.

If after reviewing these steps the issue persists, it may be due to a product limitation regarding multi-role filtering. In such cases, consider exporting the full data set and applying additional filtering in Excel or another analytics tool as a temporary workaround.

For further details on filter configuration and best practices, please refer to the articles linked above.

We hope this guidance helps you achieve the desired reporting outcome. If you have any additional questions or require clarification on the filter setup, please let us know.

Sincerely,
Atlas
Khoros Community Classic Support Team.

> Case Subject: Filters Not Working as Expected in Community Analytics Reporting
> Case Description: 
> When looking to pull reports from the Community Analytics section in the tool and applying filters. The filters do not seem to be operating as expected. Specifically, under community dashboard, I select Community Analytics, select Content from the left navigation panel, followed by forums. We then alter our date range to Year to Date and select the pencil icon to build filters. We create a total of 4 filters: 1) Role, not equals, Admin, 2) Role, not equals, LPL Home Office, 3) Role, not equals, Moderator, 4) Board name, equals, Emerging Leaders Forum or Atria Acclimation Forum or LPL Innovators Forum. Goal for pulling this report is to be able to see the page views, threads, and members analytics within the Conversations & Members tabs. However, when looking at the Members' tab under top 50, it includes individuals who have been assigned the roles (Admin, LPL Home Office, Moderator) that we applied the filter not to include. For example, for Emerging Leaders, ryan.mcclain, trayce.brown1, charles.bennington who are all Moderators are still appearing in the dashboard for top 50 under the member's tab
> 
>  
>
